The 'Middle Rocks' () are two uninhabited small rocks separated by 250 metres of
open water located at the eastern opening of the Straits of Singapore on the
western edge of the South China Sea. Previously claimed by both Malaysia and
Singapore, the International Court of Justice ruled in 2008 that the rocks
belong to Malaysia.
categories: Islands of the South China Sea
